Prompt:
Example 1:
Cat and Dog walk. They walk in their village. Then they see an egg. The egg is in the grass. The egg is alone in the grass. The egg is all alone. Cat and Dog walk to a bird. They ask the bird, "Is this your egg?" But the bird says, "No, that is not my egg. Ask the owl. Maybe it is his egg." Cat and Dog walk to the owl. They ask the owl, "Is this your egg?" But the owl says, "No, that is not my egg. Ask the goose. Maybe it is her egg." Cat and Dog walk to the goose. They ask the goose, "Is this your egg?" But the goose says, "No, that is not my egg. Ask the two ducks. Maybe it is their egg." Cat and Dog walk to the two ducks. They ask the two ducks, "Is this your egg?" But the two ducks say, "No, that is not our egg." Then the egg breaks.

Example 2:
The Sun’s light shines on Earth. The light makes our air, land, and water warm. But some things get
warmer than others.
Pretend it is a sunny day. If you wore a black shirt, you would feel hot. But if you wore a white shirt, you wouldn’t feel as hot. The dark color absorbs more of the Sun’s energy. That makes the black shirt warm.
Light colors reflect more of the Sun’s energy. This makes the white shirt cooler to wear. See for yourself! You need a piece of black paper and a piece of white paper. You also need two thermometers and a lamp. Ask an adult to help you.
Fold the black paper so it makes a pocket. Do the same thing to the white paper. Next, put a thermometer into the black pocket. Do the same thing to the white pocket. Then put the pockets under the lamp. Turn the lamp on, and wait for 10 minutes. Then check the thermometers.
Which pocket got hotter — the black pocket or the white one? Do you know why?

When you go on the computer, you have to be careful. This is because of computer security. You have to be kind to the computer, but also to your personal things. A password is like a secret name that only you know. You have to type it to get into your computer. This keeps your pictures and messages safe. If you don’t type your password, you might get into trouble. Imagine you have a secret box. You put your pictures and messages inside. You want to keep it safe. You only let the people you trust get into the box. You lock the box with a special key. That is like a password. It keeps your secret box safe from the people you don’t trust. So, always be kind to your computer and keep your password safe. Then, you can enjoy your computer without any problems.  - end of paragraph -

**Computer Security**

The computer is a safe. A safe is a place to keep things private. We keep our computers safe with passwords. A password is a secret word or number. We use our password to unlock our computer. This way, only we can use our computer. But sometimes our password can be stolen. A thief can guess our password or look at it when we are not looking. Then they can use our computer. This is not good. It is like someone is breaking into our safe. We need to be careful with our password. We should not tell anyone our password. We should not write it down. We should not leave our computer alone. Then our computer will be safe. Only we can use it. Only we can keep our computer safe.

The computer is a big machine. It has lots of information in it. The information is like a treasure. We want to keep it safe. Computer security is like a safe box. We use a lock to keep people out. We use a password to keep people out. We use a special code to keep people out. But sometimes people find the lock, the password, or the code. They want to get into the safe box. We call them hackers. Hackers try to find ways to get into the safe box. We must be careful. We must use a strong lock, a strong password, and a strong code. We must not tell people our secret. We must keep the safe box locked all the time. If we keep the safe box locked, our treasure is safe. The computer is safe. We are safe.

Pretend it is a sunny day. If you wore a black shirt, you would feel hot. But if you wore a white shirt, you wouldn’t feel as hot. The dark color absorbs more of the Sun’s energy. That makes the black shirt warm.
Light colors reflect more of the Sun’s energy. This makes the white shirt cooler to wear. See for yourself! You need a piece of black paper and a piece of white paper. You also need two thermometers and a lamp. Ask an adult to help you.
Fold the black paper so it makes a pocket. Do the same thing to the white paper. Next, put a thermometer into the black pocket. Do the same thing to the white pocket. Then put the pockets under the lamp. Turn the lamp on, and wait for 10 minutes. Then check the thermometers.
Which pocket got hotter — the black pocket or the white one? Do you know why?

The Computer's shield is up. It is protecting us from bad people. But some computers don’t have a shield. They can get hurt. That makes the computer sick. If the computer gets sick, we might lose our information. That would be very sad. The shield helps us keep our information safe. It is like wearing a helmet when we ride a bike. The helmet protects our head from bumping into things. The shield protects our computer from bad people. It helps us keep our information safe and sound. But we need to make sure we turn on the shield every time we use the computer. If we don’t, the computer might get hurt. That would make us very sad. We need to keep our computer safe and sound. The shield is very helpful. We should always use it.

Using vocabulary and structure from examples, write a short paragraph about 'computer security' targeting the same readability level (Early Elementary), limited to 150 words.  Keep it short and fun.

Imagine you have a special box called a computer. It keeps all your secrets inside. You lock the box with a secret code so only you can get in. But sometimes, bad guys try to break into your box. They use special tools called viruses to try to guess your secret code. If they succeed, they can get into your box and see all your secrets! To keep your secrets safe, you should never share your secret code with anyone. And always be careful when you open emails or download things from the internet. It's like keeping your front door locked when you're not home. If you do all these things, your secrets will stay safe in your special computer box!

Imagine you have a computer. You use your computer to play games and write stories. But there are bad people who want to see your secrets. They might try to break into your computer. We call this a cyber-attack. If they succeed, they can see all your games and stories. They might even steal your games or stories. So, we need computer security. Computer security is like a strong door that keeps the bad people out. It is like a lock that you can use to keep your computer safe. You can use a password to lock your computer. A password is a secret code that only you know. You can also use a firewall to keep the bad people out. A firewall is like a wall that keeps the bad people from getting to your computer. We must always use computer security to keep our computers safe.

* The paragraph should be easy to understand and follow for Early Elementary readers.
